abstract:
In this talk we will present the often overlooked issue of privacy
preservation while extracting or sharing insights from data sets
containing sensitive information. We will review the various techniques
used today for privacy-preserving data sharing (from k-anonymity to
differential privacy in their different flavours), and discuss the
strengths and weaknesses of each. We will explain why it is hard to
share useful data in all cases while preserving the privacy and what can
be done to mitigate this. We will finish by pointing to a selection of
promising approaches enabling the implementation of privacy-preserving
data sharing.
description:
This talk presents the issue of extracting insights from data sets
containing sensitive information, while preserving privacy. We will
review the techniques used today for private data sharing and their
limitations. We will explain why it is hard to share useful data while
preserving the privacy and point to promising approaches enabling the
implementation of such a goal.
title: Privacy-preserving Data Sharing
